commit.message:
Fix wrong flushing issue

Signed-off-by: Florian Grabmeier <flo.grabmeier@gmail.com>

Fix assertion failure

If we try to paste when there is an offer that has no MIME types offered,
we'd fail when trying to report it to the user. Make sure to handle this
case explicitly, and report it the same way as there no being any offer
at all.
Release wl-clipboard 2.2.1

Restore signal handlers in wl-copy before spawning children

We ignore SIGHUP and SIGPIPE in wl-copy itself, yet we want our child
processes, notably cat, to still get terminated if it receives SIGPIPE.
Signal handlers set to SIG_IGN unfortunately get inherited over exec, so
reset them before execing.

Fixes https://github.com/bugaevc/wl-clipboard/issues/190

Tweak binding interfaces further

- Also check for wl_seat version
- Fix parenthesizing in a macro

Do not abort when interfaces are older than expected

Instead, let consumers abort if the missing interface is a fatal problem.
Release wl-clipboard 2.2
Tweak a couple of error messages

Use wayland-protocols.wrap from WrapDB

This refers to a release rather than Git version and doesn't require
Git to be installed.

Related to https://github.com/bugaevc/wl-clipboard/issues/182

Add Wayland as a Meson wrap subproject

Good things about this:

1. It should now be possible to build wl-clipboard without any system
   dependencies (other than Meson and the compiler toolchain), with
   everything coming from subprojects. Yet, this does not hurt the
   normal case of using system-provided dependencies for everything.

2. New enough Wayland (1.22.0, as opposed to 1.20.0 in the Meson WrapDB
   at the time of writing) now ships with a call to
   override_find_program('wayland-scanner'), so finding wayland-scanner
   works transparently.

Less than ideal things about this:

1. This requires us to specify default options (to disable Wayland
   tests, docs, and importantly DTD validation, which depends on
   libxml2) in our buildscript, not in the wrap file.

2. Wayland still doesn't ship expat and libffi as its own subprojects,
   so we have to ship the wraps in wl-clipboard alongside with Wayland
   itself.

3. If libwayland-client is found but wayland-scanner is not, the
   subproject gets built to get wayland-scanner, but our default options
   specified at dependency('wayland-client') call time are not respected
   and this throws an error about missing libxml2. This would be fixed
   if Meson allowed specifying default options in the wrap file.

Closes https://github.com/bugaevc/wl-clipboard/issues/182
Remove unnecessary Meson arrays
Don't configure wayland-protocols tests

Use SPDX license string

This is what Meson expects you to use.

Fix a warning

"format not a string literal and no format arguments [-Wformat-security]"

https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Format-Security-FAQ
Fix indentation in wl-copy.c
Bump the version to 2.2.0-rc2

Tweak --help message

To make sure it fits on 80 columns.

Mention getopt(3) features in the man page

Closes https://github.com/bugaevc/wl-clipboard/issues/131

Tweak the man page

* Remove the mention of ASCII codes
* Add another BUG entry

Add wayland-protocols as a Meson wrap subproject

Part of https://github.com/bugaevc/wl-clipboard/issues/182

Tweak error message about missing shell

The most probable reason for this is wl-clipboard being built without
xdg-shell support, which is something we're trying to discourage, and
something that typically happens with self-built wl-clipboard binaries,
as opposed to distro-provided ones.

Instead of just adding a note (which would only be helpful if you're
actively aware of the decision to build wl-clipboard without xdg-shell),
print a specialized message explicitly pointing at missing xdg-shell at
build time as the root issue, and ask the user to rebuild wl-clipboard.

Set CWD to root for background process

This releases the occupation of CWD, so that the mounting point of
removable devices containing it can be umounted.
Strongly require protocol dependencies, with opt-out

Complain when launched with closed stdio fds

This will help us diagnose such cases, which otherwise manifest as
weird hangs and other bugs.

Closes https://github.com/bugaevc/wl-clipboard/issues/153
Silence a warning
Bump the version to 2.2.0-rc1
Split and rewrite Markdown docs
Improve the wl-clipboard(1) man page

Fix a reentrancy-related regression

It is possible that the compositor gives our popup surface focus before
we ever commit a buffer. In that case, we run the rest of our logic
immediately, and popup_surface_init() knows not to proceed with creating
a buffer. However, that has regressed in commit
d66fb03313128544b36419e74578cc3fb8663aef, where we started setting
popup_surface to NULL, but still checking for wl_surface being NULL to
detect that case. Fix this by also resetting self->wl_surface to NULL.

Fixes https://github.com/bugaevc/wl-clipboard/issues/174
Tweak error messages further
